text: Lauren Dahm is an American ice hockey goaltender, currently a member of the PWHPA. == Career == Across 4 seasons with Clarkson, Dahm finished with a .568 winning percentage, a 1.72 GAA and a .928 SV%.https://www.uscho.com/stats/player/wid,5943/lauren-dahm/ After graduating, Dahm originally retired from hockey, but returned in 2016 to play for the Boston Blades of the CWHL.https://www.theicegarden.com/2016/12/16/13986240/all-star-game-lauren- dahm-cwhl-clarkson-knight She was drafted by the team 56th overall that year.https://womenshockeylife.com/cwhl-lauren-dahm-boston-worcester-blades/ Despite the team often finishing at or near the bottom of the league in three years there, she quickly became one of the most recognisible Blades players, with one of the heaviest workloads of all CWHL goaltenders.https://www.theicegarden.com/2018/4/27/17253842/cwhl-boston- blades-2017-2018-season-recap-womens-hockey-lauren-dahm-kate-leary She set the league record for most saves by a goaltender in their debut with 54 saves in her first game against the Toronto Furies.https://womenshockeylife.com/lauren- dahm-brings-determined-leadership-to-rebuilding-boston-blades/ After the CWHL folded, Dahm joined the PWHPA. She had previously turned down an invitation to the American national team during the players' boycott in 2017.https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2017/mar/25/usa-hockey-world- championships-dispute-boycott ==References== ==External links== * Biographical information and career statistics from Elite Prospect Category:Boston Blades players Category:1989 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey people from New York (state) Category:American women's ice hockey goaltenders Category:Professional Women's Hockey Players Association players
title: Lauren Dahm
